intro: Lappula baitenovii, commonly known as the Tibetan lappula, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions. Its structure includes a basal rosette of leaves and stems that are often covered in a powdery coating. Lappula baitenovii is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude habitats.
